comment.author: 93614019@N00
comment._content: Born on April 7, 1887 in Pittsfield, Massachusetts, Jack Ferry (John Francis Ferry) played for the Pittsburgh Pirates for his entire 4 year career. Ferry broke into the bigs on September 4, 1910 with the Pittsburgh Pirates, and put up a 3.15 ERA in 85.2 innings pitched in 1911, his rookie year. Most people believe that Jack Ferry's best season was 1911, when he posted a 3.15 ERA. Jack Ferry - ArmchairGM - Sports Wiki Database
